featured.text: The sandals have subsequently undergone redesign, often appearing in bright colors in line with Californian beach culture.
As is often observed, most of us tend to associate lower notes with darker colors and higher notes with brighter colors.
Some studies suggest that the act of shaping our mouths into a smile (creating a “physical smile”) can help us see the brighter, funnier side of things.
With pink cherry blossoms blooming everywhere, the valley ______ like a young bride under the bright spring sunshine.

other.text: Now scientists have come up with a new use for the bright green plant: producing renewable energy.
The colors of the fish become less bright at night.

definition.zh_def: 明亮的；光線強的；聰明的
definition.en_def: Emitting or reflecting a lot of light; intelligent or quick-witted.
definition.example: The sun is bright today, making it a perfect day for a picnic.
